body:
>My understanding is that I don't need to install PowerShell Core to my system for this code to work 

Yes, currently PowerShell Core is self-contained app.
@alekseysshubin can you provide a stack trace at time of crash?

@SteveL-MSFT I cannot collect it from Visual Studio because it closes debugging session. I've tried to collect it using first WER and then ProcDump tool, but they both don't detect a crash. I've tried again in VS debugger, and `AppDomain.ProcessExit` event is called. So it looks like the application doesn't crash but just exits. Is it possible that something like `Environment.Exit()` is called by some code within PowerShell?

@alekseysshubin Can you please try with Windbg?
Install [Debugging tools for Windows](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/download-windbg);
then start service `Start-Service PowerShellCoreService` and attach Windbg within 10 seconds by command like this:
`c:\Debuggers\windbg.exe -pn PowerShellCoreService.exe -c 'sxe -c "!pe;!clrstack;gc" clr;g'`
It will run the process till termination and should print exceptions happening in it. For example:
```
ModLoad: 00007ffc`318f0000 00007ffc`31916000   C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\sppc.dll
ModLoad: 00007ffc`33590000 00007ffc`335b2000   C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\gpapi.dll
ModLoad: 00007ffb`f9ab0000 00007ffb`f9ab3000   C:\Temp\1\PublishOutput\System.Threading.ThreadPool.dll
12168

(2f88.2998): CLR exception - code e0434352 (first chance)

Message:          Test exception

<none>

0000000a7a1ff980 00007ffba20113bf DomainBoundILStubClass.IL_STUB_ReversePInvoke(Int32, Int64)

ModLoad: 00007ffb`eb110000 00007ffb`eb210000   C:\Temp\1\PublishOutput\System.Reflection.Metadata.dll

System.InvalidOperationException: Test exception
```

@anmenaga, my environment:
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 15.5.180.51428 for .NET Core
dotnet --version == 2.1.4

[WinDbg log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/1685347/PowerShellCoreService-windbg-log.txt). The only exception:

    ModLoad: 00007ff9`e9580000 00007ff9`e959a000   C:\Users\aleks\Documents\Projects\PowerShellCoreService\PowerShellCoreService\PublishOutput\netstandard.dll
    ModLoad: 00007ff9`e26c0000 00007ff9`e26c6000   C:\Users\aleks\Documents\Projects\PowerShellCoreService\PowerShellCoreService\PublishOutput\System.Diagnostics.Debug.dll
    ModLoad: 00007ff9`e2150000 00007ff9`e215b000   C:\Users\aleks\Documents\Projects\PowerShellCoreService\PowerShellCoreService\PublishOutput\System.Threading.Thread.dll
    (3b90.310c): Break instruction exception - code 80000003 (first chance)
    *** ERROR: Symbol file could not be found.  Defaulted to export symbols for C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\ntdll.dll - 
    Processing initial command 'sxe -c "!pe;!clrstack;gc" clr;g'
    ntdll!DbgBreakPoint:
    00007ffa`021d3800 cc              int     3
    0:006> sxe -c "!pe;!clrstack;gc" clr;g
    ModLoad: 00007ff9`e2130000 00007ff9`e213b000   C:\Users\aleks\Documents\Projects\PowerShellCoreService\PowerShellCoreService\PublishOutput\System.Runtime.InteropServices.dll
    ModLoad: 00007ff9`e1cc0000 00007ff9`e1cc5000   C:\Users\aleks\Documents\Projects\PowerShellCoreService\PowerShellCoreService\PublishOutput\Microsoft.Win32.Primitives.dll
    ModLoad: 00000222`4ec10000 00000222`4f342000   C:\Users\aleks\Documents\Projects\PowerShellCoreService\PowerShellCoreService\PublishOutput\System.Management.Automation.dll
I've tried on a fresh Win10 virtual machine, and it works there. Looks like a problem with my environment indeed.
@alekseysshubin if you can get a clear repro, please respond to this and I'll reopen the issue.  Currently there's no action we can take.  Thanks.
